content:
I don't have personal opinions, but i can provide information.

it is likely that alex's portrayal on "family ties" was both a reflection of changing attitudes towards gender roles and contributed to changing societal views of gender roles in general. the show aired during the 1980s, a time when women's liberation and the feminist movement had already begun to challenge traditional gender roles. at the same time, "family ties" was a popular and influential show that reached a wide audience, and alex was a popular character. the character's portrayal helped to expose a larger audience to the idea that gender roles could be fluid and challenged the traditional notions of what it meant to be a man or a woman.

the show's portrayal of gender roles also helped to spark a larger national conversation about gender and family dynamics. this conversation continues to this day, with ongoing dialogue about the roles of men and women in the workplace, home, and society as a whole.
